64tass.description: An assembler for the legendary 6502 processor and it's derivatives

altirra.description: Altirra is the 8-bit Atari emulator focusing on high-quality emulation, sometimes over speed and polish

aranym.description: ARAnyM is a VM designed and developed for running 32-bit Atari ST/TT/Falcon operating systems (TOS, FreeMiNT, MagiC and Linux-m68k) and TOS/GEM applications on any kind of hardware

arcade64.description: MAME with working arcade games only

ares.description: Multi-system emulator focused on accuracy and preservation

asap.description: ASAP is a player of Atari 8-bit chiptunes for modern computers and mobile devices

atariplusplus.description: Atari++ is an emulator of the Atari eight bit computers, namely the Atari 400 and 800, the Atari 400XL, 800XL and 130XE, and the Atari 5200 game console

b-em.description: B-em is a BBC Micro emulator

beebem.description: BeebEm is a BBC Micro and Master 128 emulator

betterjoy.description: A remapping program for Nintendo Switch controllers
notes: BetterJoy needs vigembus installed to function.
Run the ViGEm_Bus_Setup at $dir\Drivers if you have never installed ViGEm before.

bizhawk.description: BizHawk is a multi-platform emulator with full rerecording support and Lua scripting. BizHawk focuses on core accuracy and power user tools while still being an easy-to-use emulator for casual gaming

bsnes-hd-beta.description: bsnes-hd is a fork of bsnes that adds video features like rendering Mode 7 in a higher resolution, widescreen, and true color

bsnes-plus.description: emulator for the Super Nintendo / Super Famicom forked from bsnes (based on bsnes-classic) intended to introduce some new features and improvements, mostly aimed at debugging.

bsnes.description: Nintendo SNES (Super Nintendo Entertainment System) emulator

cemu.description: Experimental software to emulate Wii U applications on PC

cemuhook.description: Plugin for the Cemu emulator enabling H.264 decoding, gamepad input source overrides and game code/data patching at load-time

citra-canary.description: Emulator for Nintendo 3DS, capable of playing many of your favorite games

citra.description: Emulator for Nintendo 3DS, capable of playing many of your favorite games

demul.description: Dreamcast, Naomi, Atomiswave, Hikaru, other SuperH or PowerVR 2-based systems emulator

demulshooter.description: Hook into (mostly) emulators to allow playing rail shooter games with up to 4 lightguns or HID devices
notes: The usage instructions for the app can be found here: https://github.com/argonlefou/DemulShooter/wiki/Usage

desmume-stable.notes: No wifi emulation, most likey will never be

dolphin-beta.description: A Nintendo GameCube and Wii emulator

dolphin-dev.description: A Nintendo GameCube and Wii emulator, with enhancements and Netplay. (development version)

dolphin.description: A Nintendo GameCube and Wii emulator, with enhancements and Netplay.

notes: ATTENTION: Duckstation requires a PSX BIOS to function.
Place the BIOS file in $persist_dir\bios
Learn more at: https://www.duckstation.org/wiki/BIOS

eightyone.description: Emulator for the range of ZX home computers made by Sinclair Research (and their clones) in the 1980s, primarily the ZX80 and ZX81 but also includes the ZX Spectrum models. As well as emulating the machines themselves, various add-on interfaces are supported, including storage devices, hi-res graphics, custom character sets, sound and colour cards.

electrem.description: ElectrEm is an emulator of the Acorn Electron, an 8bit microcomputer first launched in 1983

epsxe.description: Playstation emulator, that has been around for good bit
epsxe.notes: May require bioses, also may not work with every PSX game.

fbneo-nightly.description: Emulator for arcade games and select consoles

fbneo.description: Emulator for arcade games and select consoles
notes: Some users will get an error message when they start the emulator because the default renderer is using Direct3D 7.
To change the renderer, go to Video > Select blitter.

flycast-dev.description: Sega Dreamcast, Naomi and Atomiswave emulator

flycast.description: Sega Dreamcast, Naomi and Atomiswave emulator

gbeplus.description: A gameboy trying to emulate ALL the peripherals for the gameboy

gearboy.description: Game Boy / Gameboy Color emulator for iOS, macOS, Raspberry Pi, Windows, Linux, BSD and RetroArch.

gearsystem.description: Sega Master System / Game Gear / SG-1000 emulator for iOS, macOS, Raspberry Pi, Windows, Linux, BSD and RetroArch.

handy.description: An Atari Lynx Emulator for Windows 95/98/NT/2000

hatari.description: An Atari ST/STE/TT/Falcon emulator that aims to emulate the hardware of a ST as accurately as possible

higan.description: A multi-system emulator that is quite large.

iv-play.description: IV/Play - A small and powerful MAME front-end.

pre_install: Write-Host -ForegroundColor Yellow "WARN: MAME no longer provides up to date 32bit binaries"

mameui.description: MAMEUI is the x64 GUI version of MAME on the Windows platform.

medgui-reborn.description: Frontend and launcher for Mednafen multi emulator

notes: ATTENTION: Mednafen requires BIOS/firmware files for Playstation 1, PC Engine, and PC FX emulation.
It is recommended to place these in $persist_dir\firmware.
See https://mednafen.github.io/documentation/#Section_firmware_bios for more information.
ATTENTION: Mednafen requires BIOS/firmware files for Playstation 1, PC Engine, and PC FX emulation.
It is recommended to place these in $persist_dir\firmware.
See https://mednafen.github.io/documentation/#Section_firmware_bios for more information.

pre_install: Write-Host -ForegroundColor Yellow "Mednafen and Mednafen-dev were found on this system."
Write-Host -ForegroundColor Yellow "Choose one to use mednaffe with, 1 (stable) or 2 (dev)"
Write-Host -ForegroundColor Yellow "No Mednafen installation was found on this system."
Write-Host -ForegroundColor Yellow "Choose 1 to install Mednafen stable, 2 for Mednafen-dev, or 3 to cancel the install."

mesen-s.description: Nintendo SNES (Super Nintendo Entertainment System) and Super Game Boy emulator
mesen-s.notes: Configuration files cannot be persisted, but will be retained during the update

mesen.description: Nintendo NES (Nintendo Entertainment System) and Famicom emulator

mgba-dev.description: A fast, accurate, and portable GBA emulator (development version)

model-b.description: model-b is a BBC Micro emulator

model3.description: Emulates Sega's Model 3 arcade platform, allowing you to relive state-of-the-art 3D arcade gaming as it existed from 1996 through 1999. It uses OpenGL, SDL2, and can run on Windows, Linux, and macOS. It also supports network play on low-latency network connections.

nanoboyadvance.description: NanoBoyAdvance is a Game Boy Advance emulator focused on accuracy.

nester.description: Nintendo Entertainment System emulator for Windows

nestopia.description: A portable and cycle-accurate NES/Famicom emulator written in C++

openmsx-dev.notes: User data are stored in C:\Users\[USERNAME]\Documents\openMSX

openmsx.notes: User data are stored in C:\Users\[USERNAME]\Documents\openMSX

pcsx2-dev.description: A feature rich FOSS PlayStation 2 emulator (development version)
notes: ATTENTION: PCSX2 requires a dump of the PS2 BIOS to function.
Place the BIOS file in $persist_dir\bios
Learn more at https://wiki.pcsx2.net/Setting_up_Windows_version#BIOS

pcsx2.description: A feature rich FOSS PlayStation 2 emulator
notes: ATTENTION: PCSX2 requires a dump of the PS2 BIOS to function.
Place the BIOS file in $persist_dir\bios
Learn more at https://wiki.pcsx2.net/Setting_up_Windows_version#BIOS

pegasus-nightly.description: Pegasus is a graphical frontend for browsing your game library and launching all kinds of emulators from the same place

pegasus.description: Pegasus is a graphical frontend for browsing your game library and launching all kinds of emulators from the same place

phoenixemu.description: Phoenix is an emulator of 3DO Interactive Player and Atari Jaguar written by Maxim Grishin

prosystem.description: The ProSystem Emulator is an Atari 7800 emulator for the PC

punes-opengl.description: Qt-based Nintendo Entertaiment System emulator and NSF/NSFe Music Player (OpenGL Version)

punes.description: Qt-based Nintendo Entertaiment System emulator and NSF/NSFe Music Player (Direct3D Version)

raine.description: RAINE is an emulator for arcade games

retroarch-nightly.description: Frontend for emulators, game engines and media players (nightly)
notes: ATTENTION: Retroarch requires BIOS/firmware files for some emulation.
It is recommended to read the libretro docs for each core you plan to use.
See https://docs.libretro.com/library/bios/ for more information.

retroarch.description: Frontend for emulators, game engines and media players.
notes: ATTENTION: Retroarch requires BIOS/firmware files for some emulation.
It is recommended to read the libretro docs for each core you plan to use.
See https://docs.libretro.com/library/bios/ for more information.

romsorter.description: Compress, or uncompress ROMs, detect duplicates, catalog, manage CHD and DAT data, sort for Everdrive, or create 1G1R sets - all with one app
notes: ROMSorter depends on having the .NET 6 runtime installed.
The .NET 6 runtime, also known as Microsoft Windows Desktop Runtime, is available in the Extras bucket.
Since the runtime gets installed globally, Sudo is needed, which is part of the Main bucket.
For example, with Sudo installed, you could execute the following to get the dependencies: scoop install extras/windowsdesktop-runtime-lts
ATTENTION: RPCS3 requires a copy of the official PS3 firmware to function.
Install the ps3-system-software package.  You must still manually load PS3UPDAT.PUP
See the official quickstart guide for further instructions: https://rpcs3.net/quickstart

ryujinx.description: A simple, experimental Nintendo Switch emulator
notes: ATTENTION: Ryujinx requires Nintendo Switch firmware and a prod.keys file to function.
Learn more at https://github.com/Ryujinx/Ryujinx/wiki/Ryujinx-Setup-&-Configuration-Guide

saint.description: SainT is a Windows based cycle accurate ATARI-ST emulator

sameboy.description: A Game Boy and Game Boy Color emulator written in C

scummvm-nightly.description: ScummVM is a program which allows you to run certain classic graphical adventure and role-playing games

scummvm.description: ScummVM is a program which allows you to run certain classic graphical adventure and role-playing games

snes9x-dev.description: Nintendo SNES (Super Nintendo Entertainment System) emulator

snes9x.description: Nintendo SNES (Super Nintendo Entertainment System) emulator

ssf.description: Sega Saturn emulator focused on accurate hardware emulation

steam-rom-manager.description: Steam ROM Manager adds non-Steam games to steam in bulk and manages their artwork assets

steemsse.description: ST Enhanced EMulator Sensei Software Edition

tegra-rcm-gui.description: RCM exploit for Nintendo Switch (1st Gen)

vice-stable.description: VICE is an emulator collection which emulates the C64, the C64-DTV, the C128, the VIC20, practically all PET models, the PLUS4 and the CBM-II (aka C610). It runs on Unix, MS-DOS, Win32, OS/2, Acorn RISC OS, BeOS, QNX 6.x, Amiga, GP2X or Mac OS X machines.

vice.description: Updated builds of the VICE emulator

visualboyadvance-sdl.description: A gameboy and gameboy advance emulator

visualboyadvance.description: A gameboy and gameboy advance emulator

notes: Warning: XEBRA.INI is not persisted across updates because of version incompatibilities.
If you use BIOS with XEBRA, rename BIOS as "OSROM" and overwrite $dir\OSROM
If you use Video plugin with XEBRA, rename plugin as "VIDEO.DLL" and overwrite $dir\VIDEO.DLL,
and check "View">"Video Output">"Use VIDEO.DLL"
Learn more at: http://drhell.web.fc2.com/ps1/xebra/index2.html

yuzu-pineapple.description: A Yuzu Early Access fork with Linux-specific patches

yuzu.description: Experimental emulator for the Nintendo Switch
